root.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
root.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
root.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the main cause of a problem
root.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The love of money is the root of all evil.
A competent mechanic should be able to get to the root of the problem (=find out the cause of a problem).
Allergies are at the root of a lot of health problems.
be/lie at the root of something
root.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the origin or main part of something such as a custom, law, activity etc, from which other things have developed
root.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Jazz has its roots in the folk songs of the southern states of the US.
the liberal economic policies which lie at the root of American power
be/lie at the root of something
a legal system with roots in English common law
root.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the part of a tooth, hair etc that connects it to the rest of your body
root.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: She’d pulled some of Kelly’s hair out by the roots.
root.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the basic part of a word which shows its main meaning, to which other parts can be added. For example, the word ‘coldness’ is formed from the root ‘cold’ and the suffix ‘ness’.
root.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a number that, when multiplied by itself a certain number of times, equals the number that you have
root.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: New shrubs will root easily in summer.
root.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a plant is rooted somewhere, it is held in the ground firmly by its roots
root.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: a bush firmly rooted in the hard ground
Clumps of thyme had rooted themselves between the rocks.
root.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to search for something by moving things around
root.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Leila rooted through her handbag for a pen.
root.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: if a pig roots somewhere, it looks for food under the ground
